content:
I want to negotiate. Can you give me some tips?

1. Start with a lower price than what you're willing to pay.
2. Be polite and professional.
3. Show interest in the property.
4. Be prepared to walk away if the deal doesn't work out.
5. Be open to compromise.
6. Suggest alternative payment options or terms.
7. Bring any relevant information about your financial situation or needs.
name: Aziz Trabelsi from Tunesia

content:
Great tips! Here are some additional suggestions:

8. Research the current rental market in the area to get a better idea of what the fair market rate is.
9. Consider the location and condition of the apartment, as well as any additional amenities or features, when negotiating the price.
10. Be transparent about your expectations and requirements, but also be willing to be flexible if necessary.
11. Keep the conversation focused on the rental price and avoid discussing other topics, such as utilities or other expenses.
12. If you feel that the negotiator is not being reasonable, consider bringing in a third party, such as a real estate agent, to help facilitate the negotiations.
name: Heinrich Heine
